So, the first thing I have to say is... Wow! The entire map look wonderful, and the colors a vibrant and fantastic! I've seen a space age paradise, and I dont think I'll stop playing for a long long time. Second thing I have to say, Some of you fellow players have some tough builds, looking forward to fighting more!

All shock and awe aside... THis game is great! You make custom ships, which then form into a custom fleet, which you use to dominate your quandrant of unlimited space. Succeed in that? Well, good things theres wormholes to new guardrants! Unlockable factions (by fighting them), which grant new games with different difficulties, builds, and weapons!

I was and am a fan of Robocraft because of its custom capabillity and design. However, robocraft in 2D space? YES.

I would like to thank the Devs, the players (even the ones whose Agents gave me a tough time), and everything that lead to this game's exsistance. 10/10 will dominate the galaxy again!

Simply amazing!
At 1st, you build spips part by part, upgrade it, get bigger unlock weapons and stuff, try it out, very cool.
Then you realize you can build and spawn whole fleets, wow!
Then you'll get to spawn, spawners following you and getting that fleet bigger and bigger.
The reassembly mecanics also adds a great gameplay element. You'll often try to escape ennemy fire so you reassemble before blowing up.
I love the score too, it's the kind of music I don't feel like muting it.

The interface is counterintuitive at times, but it's almost top notch. There are some glitches and some elements are obscure, for instance, assigning ships to spawners and the mecanic of it all.
There are not much of a clear goal as it is an open world and it feels right the way its done, The starting objectives starts as a nice tutorial, but I guess I need more time to grasp the whole picture.

All in all, it's a must have space shooter/explorer. One great kickstarter indie games.

Love the game, but one small issue, when synching the game with the cloud after playing, Steam will not allow you to play other games until this is done, but other than that it is a great and addictive game.

Since I bought this game I haven't shut it down, its all I play atm and why? because its damn addictive.

You begin with a rather small spacecraft and start your journey mining resources.
As you collect resources and trade them for money wich will be used to upgade you ship's power or add new pieces for your ship, you will explore a beautiful enviorement and face other factions throughout space.
At a certain point you will be able to build your own ships and spawn them yourself
*THIS IS WHERE IT GETS ADDICTIVE FOR ME*
As you soon will discover, the ships you built and spawned will follow you and defend you, even collect resources for you.
You will have your own armada of ships and they are all fully costumizable! Like in, you build them from scratch till you and only you are satisfied with its looks.

So basicly whats good about the game:
-customize your own fleet.
-Nice environment
-Have your own armada
-game controls ( I play with keyboard and mouse)
-Grafix ( if you're into this kind of old school 2-d spacebattle-thingies)

Some things did bother me:
-No multiplayer (-You do have a sort of multiplayer as in sending your fleet to a friend (separate file) wich he can import in game and have an AI fight with. And there is a thing called agents wich are playermade ships who spawn in your map to haunt you.)
-No control over spawned ships. In command mode you can sell or buy allied ships but you cannot control them as in sending them in a direction, generally the spawned ships will follow you and defend you at their best ( wich is up to you on how you build them ;) )

Sorry for any mistakes and poor english
Hope you will buy this game and have as much fun as I do playing it

To the Dev: If you ever read this=> I will Buy Reassembly 2 early acces or even kickstart if you add a multiplayer/co-op!!

this game benefits from the following:
Extremely addicting gameplay; an easy to use shipbuilder; a simple, yet appealing art style; an amazing soundtrack; diverse enemy ships; the ability to battle with other people's ship fleets; and a vast modding community.

that said, it can sometimes get annoying when every single agent (Player-designed fleet) comes after you at once before you're ready. (but don't worry you can exact revenge on them soon enough)

it would also benefit greatly from multiplayer, which, if it were to be added, might bump it up next to other big multiplayer games.

Overall, I highly reccomend this game to any who like Space, LEGOs, and blowing things up for money.

reviewText:
Great game. Simple mechanic yet very addictive: you can create any kind of craft you want. Be it a big and slow heavily armed cruiser or a fast and nimble smaller fighter, the combination are seemingly endless.

+ A free roaming procedurally generated galaxy" populated by different factions that fight each others for sector control.
+ Attractive but simple graphics with lots of different particle effects.
+ Greatly optimized resulting in perfectly fluid gameplay and rigid body physic despite the hundreds of objects interacting simultaneously.
+ There is a strange but appealing organic
date:
underwater feeling to the game.
+ Soundtrack fits nicely with the game ambiance.
+ Incoming MODs support via Steamworks.

- Some factions could have been better balanced and lack variety in spacecraft design.

If you like old school 2D space shooters
recommended: give this one a try. The ship designing aspect adds a nice touch to the genre."

When I first saw this game being played, it reminded me of fish in an aquarium, just with the ability to shoot lasers at each other. Even now, after I know it's a space game, it still has that organic look.

This is a great game. It runs very well on an older laptop, and when things get too intense with the graphics, the program simply steps down speed rather than crashes. The design interface for the ship editor is very well done and you can zoom in and out. It has a lot of things you can use, but just enough so you do not get overwhelmed from too much inventory to choose from.

Piloting your ships is a little tricky, since it involves the cursor and the keyboard and even then you have settings to choose from. My best analogy of piloting a ship in Reassembly is like riding a horse, where you use rein to control the speed and steer your steed.

The conquer the universe mode is pretty straightforward and you got lots of time to build up resource. The tutorial helps you get things rolling though I was hoping for more, like for example what exactly am I scooping off these asteroids? To date, I've never been wiped off the map for being too slow. If you beat an agent, you unlock a faction to play.

THe sandbox mode? Okay, that's the first real negative on this game. I'm old enough to have played games that involved you using complex commands in a text editor  to create the scenerio before the game began, so let me tell you I've never seen a sandbox mode that involved command language since the 1980s. This would have been acceptable for the 1980s but this is the 21st century, and most computer users are not programmers. They would expect an Activision-esque style of interface where you select number of players, difficulty level, type of victory scenerio and so on. AFter seeing a dazzling UI, asking the user to create a sandbox match using command line languages gives this game a unfinished look. It's not a deal breaker. I got more than my money's worth out of it, but I would have loved to see what the sandbox mode was like.

My verdict? Worth it, lot of replayability value and you will have hours of fun designing things and watching them go blooey. Just skip the sandbox mode.

asteroids 2015 edition\n\n

Reassembly is a very simple game, you are a ship for a faction and all other factions are enemies; that doesnt sound too different to most games; although the real point of the game is the fact that you can build and design your own ships. This mechanic is very well implemented and the game is really fun, flying round space blowing stuff up really never gets old. The building ship feature is very, very good (it could do with some fixs and some more variations), everything on the ship is down to you if it is too slow thats your faut (add more thrusters) or its just getting smashed against flagships and agents (add hull and shields) you can change it and upgrade it to fix these problems. Everytime you die there is something you can do to imporve the ship, you learn from every mistake and can adapt to it. There is something about this game that just brings me back to being a 5 year old playing with Lego and trying make HUGE planes and space ships. Really great little gem of a game.\nTL;DR Great little gem, lots of replayability, buy if you have ever played with Lego.

One of my favorite games, if you like customization and spaceships, or pseudo roguelike-likes. This is the game for you.\n\nPsuedo due to, however many resources you collect when alive, when killed you lose ALL of it. But it isn't anything to cry over. The game features infinite ship customizational freedom with each part to the ship being in sections of small blocks, so you can create whatever you wish.

If you were into to building space ships with legos or drawing them as a kid(or do as an adult) you will get to bring them to life with this game.

I have sit down to play this for a little while only to realize once I am finished a few hours have passed.

There are 7 unique factions to choose from and some others made by the community. I haven’t tested any of those community ones yet so I cannot judge those.

There is a bit of a grind to unlock all the different parts for your ship but the reward of using those parts to design the craziest, strongest or just silliest ship you can is worth it. Fighting fleets designed by other players(AI controlled) known in the game as agents is the most fun way to test those ships. The test option on the design screen is probably the truest test of them though. Basically your ship fights someone else's design around the same point value both are ai controlled.

How much time you will spend playing this is really based around how fun you find designing. So if you are the type of person who will spend hours creating characters just to see if something will work the way you think it's probably a good game for you.

It starts off with a nice 3-20 hours of playing before you have done it all, then it's all about building new ship designs, and flying them around in arcade mode.\n\nI'm building new ships with my daughter, she loves it. The biggest problem is that the parts are not symetrical so while things look good you can have a real hard time to make them fit together. Also while you get to play against the ships of other players, there aren't that super many of them around.

I made a ship that's also a giant mouth, with plasma guns on the teeth. I used it to conquer a huge swathe of the galaxy, devouring all who crossed my path. None could stop me. Then I met my match. A huge, blocky warship covered in enormous plasma cannons. So I upgraded my ship. I went up to the level of battlecruiser. But I still couldn't destroy it.

Eventually, after much fighting, I worked out that the command module was vulnerable at the back. I downgraded to a tiny corvette and flew up behind it. I started firing my weapons, staying out of range of the heavy plasma cannons. My beams gnawed away as the other battleships approached. Then I got through the armour. I smashed the command pod.

I had won.

So yeah, it's pretty good.

This game is a lot of fun.  I still play it on occasion.  I have played all of the races to their max, and I still find some fun stuff to do.\n\nYou build your ship out of geometric shapes and weaponry, and can build a fleet of your own ships.  As you build ships / stations, the randomly generated galaxy will start to incorporate them.  As far as I can tell, this works across save files as well.  I built a great ship with one race that was pretty much unstoppable and it showed up when I was playing another race as an agent.

Step 1: Build Giant Battleship with TONS of Armor

Step 2: Crash Giant Battleship on a Giant space Rock

Step 3: Watch puny little fighters attack your STRONK Battleship and laugh

Step 4: Watch a Bigger, Better, Giant-er Battleship destroy your crashed Battleship and cry

Step 5: Build Bigger Battleship and crash on a Bigger Space Rock

Step 6: Repeat

Seriously though this is a VERY Good and addicting game

10/10

I bought this game out of nostolgia for a game I played when I was younger, but I got so much more than I expected. This game is a work of art, and my sense of wonder for the game was still strong 20+ hours into the game. It's like flying a spaceship through an alien terrarium. I was worried about the lack of multi-player, however there are few bugs, and the AI are detailed, and seem to have distinct personalities based on their factions that are conveyed without a single written word. Beautiful game, worth three times as much easily.

Reassembly. A top down 2D spaceship fighting game. With several mods and 7 total venila factions, Its hard to get bored.\n\nIt is also unique in the way destruction happens. It doesnt give your ship HP and it gets destroyed when hp is 0. Insted each componet of your ship has HP, and, When destroyed, any componets attatched only with the componet that got destroyed falls of your ship as debris. If your ship regrows that part and is still in the vecinity, the ship will then tractor all the parts still there back onto the ship.

What an amazingly brilliant game.  I have to applaud the creators, I am nothing short of blown away.

Its intuitive, incredibly original, and has a ton of content.  The physics engine is phe-nom-i-nal.

BUY IT. BUY IT NOW.

Amazing! Would recomend getting the game and much of the workshop content.  (The workshop provides over double the content that the game has to offer)  Pretty sure my friends will get it as well.  A multiplayer option, even if it was just local would put this game over the edge of perfection.
This game is for you if you enjoy hours on end of constructing and fighting unique 2D spacecraft, with many choices of weaponry, armor types, maneuverability options and shapes haha.
Judging by the time I have spent on this game you should understand that it can be addicting to play. (125.2 Hours at the time of this post)
Anyway, I Love the game! 9/10 would recommend.
Keep up the fantastic work Anisoptera Games, as well as all of the workshop developers that want everyone to have a better experience!
Super fun
bcause this game is very fun... if you like space shooting builders?

Reassembly is a fantastic game! It's a pretty looking, lego-like game, that lets you build your own ship from a measly fighter to an unstoppable jauggernaut capital ship. There are quite a few unique factions to unlock and build with that are all pretty fun to play as with their own special weapon types and building blocks.

Although I full heartedly reccommend this game I think it's important point out some gripes.

End Game Is kinda boring
-Reassembly is one of those games where you become so powerful that there simply isn't strong enough competition to personally test your work of art against. There are some fleets you can battle that can be difficult but often times they can be really easy.

Faction Economy and territyory system isn't fleshed out
-Gaining and losing territory seems very ambiguous and pointless beyond %100 conquering the map, which is tedious and time consuming. There doesn't seem to be any benefit of having territory. You're supposed to give resources to ship building factories that will then go out and gain territory, but this is kind of un-engaging past bringing the materials in.
-There aren't really any capital" territories that faction forces are strongest at. Having these would bring in some depth to the world
date: adding difficulty and strategy to your campaign. Attack the capital of a faction and cripple it's economy so it can't reinforce other territories as easily. Some factions have cargo ships that don't really do anything but get killed by you for some free money. Giving them something to do that has benifits would be amazing for this game.\n\nBeyond anything I've mentioned the game is a great time! If you're even slightly considering picking this up
recommended: do it! Especially if it's on sale."

Simply amazing!
At 1st, you build spips part by part, upgrade it, get bigger unlock weapons and stuff, try it out, very cool.
Then you realize you can build and spawn whole fleets, wow!
Then you'll get to spawn, spawners following you and getting that fleet bigger and bigger.
The reassembly mecanics also adds a great gameplay element. You'll often try to escape ennemy fire so you reassemble before blowing up.
I love the score too, it's the kind of music I don't feel like muting it.

The interface is counterintuitive at times, but it's almost top notch. There are some glitches and some elements are obscure, for instance, assigning ships to spawners and the mecanic of it all.
There are not much of a clear goal as it is an open world and it feels right the way its done, The starting objectives starts as a nice tutorial, but I guess I need more time to grasp the whole picture.

All in all, it's a must have space shooter/explorer. One great kickstarter indie games.

reviewText: It good
It's like a fishtank -- but with spaceships of varying size that have nothing better to do than blow one another up forever.
One of the most fun games I've played all year

I'd had this game in my wishlist for a while, was one of those games i intended to pick up on a sale or something.

By Odins beard, i should of got it sooner.

Its truly amazing, the sheer addictiveness of it is astounding, and creating newer and better ships is such a fun aspect. Its essentially a game where you just constantly grind either mining or fighting, but thats the best bit. The grind is so good.

Everytime i go to close it and stop, i just think, ill get a little more, then upgrade.

But its a never ending cycle.

IT NEVER ENDS

Since I bought this game I haven't shut it down, its all I play atm and why? because its damn addictive.

You begin with a rather small spacecraft and start your journey mining resources.
As you collect resources and trade them for money wich will be used to upgade you ship's power or add new pieces for your ship, you will explore a beautiful enviorement and face other factions throughout space.
At a certain point you will be able to build your own ships and spawn them yourself
*THIS IS WHERE IT GETS ADDICTIVE FOR ME*
As you soon will discover, the ships you built and spawned will follow you and defend you, even collect resources for you.
You will have your own armada of ships and they are all fully costumizable! Like in, you build them from scratch till you and only you are satisfied with its looks.

So basicly whats good about the game:
-customize your own fleet.
-Nice environment
-Have your own armada
-game controls ( I play with keyboard and mouse)
-Grafix ( if you're into this kind of old school 2-d spacebattle-thingies)

Some things did bother me:
-No multiplayer (-You do have a sort of multiplayer as in sending your fleet to a friend (separate file) wich he can import in game and have an AI fight with. And there is a thing called agents wich are playermade ships who spawn in your map to haunt you.)
-No control over spawned ships. In command mode you can sell or buy allied ships but you cannot control them as in sending them in a direction, generally the spawned ships will follow you and defend you at their best ( wich is up to you on how you build them ;) )

Sorry for any mistakes and poor english
Hope you will buy this game and have as much fun as I do playing it

Like if the cell stage from 'Spore' and gummy ship stages from 'Kingdom Hearts' had a baby! It's pretty, the music is good and you will spend hours designing ships only to toss them away minutes later in favor of designing something new.
There is a bit of a learning curve, but as your ship grows so does the addiction!

Well... At first I wasn't really excited about this. But when you managed to destroy your first enemy ship, with something you build on your own, this game will capture your attention and your heart as well.

Yes, the gameplay is simple, but it makes you want to build bigger, better, deadlier ships. The graphics are simple as well, but completely mesmerizing.

Normally I am not very much into sandbox stuff, because I don't have the patience to design something nice from scratch. But these things don't have to be pretty. Just glue weapons, hull and shields together and let 'em go. And if you fail - instant respawn and the possibility to make the ship better. So you trial and error" your way through the galaxy. And it doesn't even make me mad - it would if it wasn't that way.

Highly recommended to players who like FTL or Spore. This is kind of a mix of both. And I love it."

The upgrade tab is a bit limited and I wish there were more too it like an unlockables tree, I also wish the game would add a multiplayer but still, BUY THE GAME, I promise it's worth it!

reviewText: The game feels really unfinished and it seems as if someone got bored with working on it and just published what they got done. That being said, I have 19 hours on it for a reason: it is still a blast. I can't imagine how fun it would be if they actually finished the game. It is somewhat like old spaceship fighter games, but with a fairly complex designing system. The damage on the ships is pretty fun too- parts get blown off when they get hit and slowly you reassemble over time if you make it to safety. You are supposed to take over territory, but the system for it isn't complete and it is a somewhat broken, annoying bruteforce type of take-over required to gain meaningful territory,
Way more fun then a dollar indi game should be.\n

It's like Asteroid, it's like Subspace, it's like Homeworld...  it's a pretty damn good concept, well executed and addictive.  You basically are thrown in the middle of space with a small ship and you have to gather ressources to make your ship bigger, and build more space ships that will themselves build other ships on their own.  It is a living game, where the environement changes and where enemy factions fight for control of the ressources.   Get ready for intense action: sometimes more than 500 ships fighting at the same time!

I do enjoy this game, its fun to just sink time into and destroy an entire colony of spikey plants with your 20+ probe fleet.

I'll give this game a tentative thumbs up. It's fun, the UI isn't too bad, it's nice creating ships where you have to worry about thruster position, centre of mass (both easily done with a symmetrical ship), if the ship has enough thrusters to maintain a decent speed (space friction is in effect here) or rotate rapidly enough (my main issue when designing). But then once all is said and done there's an issue: Once you get good enoguh at ship design and you've tried it with all the factions (or all the ones you like) there's nothing to really do. The starting grind is boring, running around demolishing every AI ship, agent or not, is boring. One well designed ship helmed by a player can and will crap on everything.\n\nI feel one thing this game needs is a true multiplayer to keep it fresh for longer. As it stands, once you have a death ship (my antimatter dreadnought comes to mind) there's no way in hell anything is ever gonna kill you. Tournament mode, this game's multiplayer"

Okay, first off...I spent hours on the game the minute I bought it. I made a really ♥♥♥♥ ship at the start, spent all the money in extra P, and now, it's probably the most destructive force in the universe, plus the extra 83 smaller ships I created. And that's only the first faction! :D

Most people will have grandoise ideas of the ships they can build and they are probably possible. But! you won't be making those ship right out of the gate or even soon after. There is a pacing to the game and it's done rather well. Depending on how content you are with the status-quo you can rush to make bigger ships or not. A very fun game that you'll probably get your money's worth before it possibly out stays it's welcome in unlocking different races.
Asteroids meets an open world with ship customization. Hopefully we'll see story elements added while it's in development.

Those commenting that this is a hidden gem is right. Damn is it unexpectedly interesting. Yes, I did buy it due to the positive reviews and the mentioned ship building. However never did I expect it to be so refreshingly unlimited. Because every weapon can shoot through your hull (presumably because it is actually on top) and hull is free, you could make a giant ship right from the start. however, it would be slow or almost uncontrollable thanks to its mass, but fight a few more ships and you might just get the dough to add more thrusters. Suddenly you could build yourself a flying wrecking ball. Is insanely small, high impact more you? Go for it. Want to have weapons all over your ship? Sure. Everything is at your fingers and damn is it addicting to constantly build, test it in a fight just to lose horribly and then rebuild it in a different way to achieve glorious victory. Heck even after you win, you might just realize that you forgot to add enough storage so you cannot collect all those resources you just earned.
Sunk hours in to this game and will continue to do so. If you're on the fence about buying it, you won't regret it.

Very fun game, fell in love with it the hour I started playing it.  Good balance of physics and combat, and I really have no complaints other than when you get 8000 P you're kinda overpowered. Just a tiny bit. I would love to see maybe a co-op function over lan/internet or even a versus mode with the same connections.\n\nAll in all, 9.5/10

30 hour update: OK, I get it now. This game is a brilliant, highly addictive combination of RTS, shoot-em-up, bullet hell, and sandbox. It's digitial space Lego, with a slick aesthetic and beautiful sound track to boot. The moment when my brand new Starcraft Battlecruiser, the Norad III, materialized for the first time was one of the most simply and deeply satisfying in any video game ever.
[positive review]

The game feels really unfinished and it seems as if someone got bored with working on it and just published what they got done. That being said, I have 19 hours on it for a reason: it is still a blast. I can't imagine how fun it would be if they actually finished the game. It is somewhat like old spaceship fighter games, but with a fairly complex designing system. The damage on the ships is pretty fun too- parts get blown off when they get hit and slowly you reassemble over time if you make it to safety. You are supposed to take over territory, but the system for it isn't complete and it is a somewhat broken, annoying bruteforce type of take-over required to gain meaningful territory,
Very good, much spaceships. A++ would buy again

If you loved playing with or building lego space ships as a kid, then this is probably your dream game. It's a little hard to get into at first, but once you understand the mechanics of what is good/bad on ships, and how to maintain growth within your faction, then the game becomes a joy. Also if you're a perfectionist you can spend hours upon hours just building and testing ships. I know I have.

Very nice game, love the idea, love how it was all works, and the amount of players on it. It's also addicting, because you can just make a hole bunch of unique ships and get a big difference in each ship. Add a bunch of factions to it, and you get a huge variety of ships that you can make. The games environment is also beautiful.
The only problem that i have with this game, is the price. Its not bad, but it could be lessened to 10$ tops.

All in all, the game is worth the bucks. 9/10
(would recommend getting it on sale tho :P )
It is an awsome build your own battle ship 2D game you fight other crafts unlock weapons in my opinnion its my favorite game.

When I was about to play the game I though it was going to be boring because its seem to be the same as a lot of other game out there(you built a space ship and fight.) Oh boy I was wrong this game got me hooked and now I can't stop playing, there is a lot more than just building and fighting like builting up the faction you have upgrading the space ship and each and every faction has some other items that others don't. I rating of this game is a... OVER 9000/10

Great game for my brick to play on, with not even minimized settings gets me 60fps and also with Steam workshop mod support once you have had enough, you get get more to have enough of, and with the in-game mod screen allows easy changes to what mods you are using at a certain time.

It's a good game that has a classic styly of gameplay. It has the added bonus of allowing you to build your own ships and perfect them.

The worlds you play in are procedurally created, but I wish there were more of a  variaty of obstacles and hazards in the game.

I like the various factions you can fight and play, but I long for more varied ship designs.

No story mode, but it really doesn't need one.

No multipleyer, but the single player game work just fine.

The keyboard layout ssems a bit spread out, but I use and older Nostromo N52 speed pad and it makes this game play nearly perfect.

The AI for both your own faction and the enemy factions could use improvements.

There are mods that fix things, and sometime ruin them.

In conclusion:  The game is not perfect, but it's still a fun time.
Spent a lot of my childhood playing flash games like Bubbletanks and Flashtrek Broken Mirror. This is like those but fun.
Reassembly is one of the best sandbox games out there! you build spaceships and fight not only seven diffrent factions but agents (play based content). this game is simpily amazing

It's like spore's cell stage, but actually fun.

Seriously, though. It's an incredibly fun game, and though it suffers from the drawback of many sandbox games (in that the coolest designs aren't necessarily the most pracitacal) I enjoyed it a lot. A bit tricky whn you're starting out but once you unlock the factory and figure out how to build a fleet it's pretty awesome.

Great soundtrack and aesthetics. Fun gameplay. Overall a great game
This game reminds me of Elite: Dangerous only its 2D, you build your own ships, and its more fun!

The first 30 minutes were quite confusing with stuff flying everywhere. Then I realized the potential and depth of this game. Even with simple graphics, it is possible to create awesome ships and fleets. There is also room for a lot of interesting strategies. Want a sentry outpost, just create one. Want a frontline factory, build one.

Already many great mods out there, that also add to the depth and complexity.

The only thing I'm missing is multiplayer. I know it is impossible to implement without rewriting the whole code, but if they ever make a sequel with MP, that game could easily be among the top games on steam.

I don't usually play 2d space shooters, especially if they have strategy elements, but this shooter has won my heart. The addictive cycle of build, play, collect, repeat is unstoppable. I am having fun at every stage, from tiny little thruster and a gun" ships all the way up to giant capital ships with shields and factories. Strongly recommend."
lOVE IT
Nice fun game for a while.

Alright, so I just bought this on a wim because it was cheap and looked decent.

I'm glad I was right, wasn't expecting much at first, until a lil over 6 hours later and I couldn't take my hands away.  This game has SO much replayability, limitless customization, fight the creations of everyone else, and warp to different areas that are all different.  It's essentially endless gameplay value for just a few bucks.

10/10 def worth a buy.

reviewText:
Reassembly, at first glance and without watching the trailer/gameplay, seems like a Captain Forever (i think that's what it's called) rip-off. It's not. You aren't limited to trying to destroy the enemy core ASAP to save it's pieces so you can upgrade your ship, although you pretty much have to kill in order to upgrade your ship in the first place in Reassembly. It's pretty much just Asteroids but with badass looking ships instead of a dinky triangle. It's kinda hard to explain, but basically there are multiple factions, around 15 at the time of me writing this review, and you only get to be in one at the start. To get in others, you have to kill giant murder machines from other factions to unlock them. There's also a weird credits and resource system, you gain resource (called R in-game) by either farming or murdering other factions, and you get credits (called C in-game) by dropping off your resource at stations or ships with a factory on it, and then those stations/ships can use your resource you dropped off to make more ships, possibly a ship with a factory on it, making a weird cycle.

Also, pro-tip for newbies, GET THE FARMER FACE (faction 2) AS FAST AS POSSIBLE.
It's pretty much better than all of the other factions, because they can farm with ease because they can attach plants to themselves so you can essentially farm on the go, which, as previously stated, gives you resource.

All in all, if you like ship building and somewhat intense space battles, Reassembly is for you. A solid 10/10.

Most people will have grandoise ideas of the ships they can build and they are probably possible. But! you won't be making those ship right out of the gate or even soon after. There is a pacing to the game and it's done rather well. Depending on how content you are with the status-quo you can rush to make bigger ships or not. A very fun game that you'll probably get your money's worth before it possibly out stays it's welcome in unlocking different races.
Asteroids meets an open world with ship customization. Hopefully we'll see story elements added while it's in development.

Its one of those Games i can play peacefully on my poor pc, i can spend 100s hours building one ship and still be entertained, great art style, great gameplay, great system and mechanics, and the modding community is amazin'! No complaints at all!

Okay so i got this game last week and has already put in 50 hours, so in other words i really like the game, i think it's one of a kind i have never quite played something like it, i can spent hours in the ship making page, super cool, but i have found 2 problems which has had a huge negative impact on my experience

First off, factions seems to be kind pointless, because with over 50 hours, i didn't not once experienced that another faction acted as whole, in other words, a faction and all it ships just stand around completely idle doing nothing, never trying to take down station or conquer another faction unless they're within their detection range. making the game such a pushover as the enemy faction ai never challenge you, Also your own faction seems to have no AI of its own, when you're busy conquering the universe not once did a have a allied fleet come and help me unless i paid them or was in same area, unless you fly straight into the enemy fleets, which also as far as i know are completely idle if the player is not within its detection range or sector area

Second off why doesn't enemy ships evolve as time goes on? Once you have a max P ship at 8k or even 6-7k, you might as well just start another game because at that point the enemy is powerless against you, hell i even installed the mod that does so there is at all times like 40 agents on the map, and i download all the highest rate/sub modded boss fleets, even so once i hit that 6-8k P nobody can touch me...

Overall i think this game is the best sandbox space sim out there, giving it a 7,5/10 :theinterceptor:
